movies.title: Humoresque
movies.plot: Young Leon Kanter dreams of being a great violinist. His parents scrape up the money for a violin and for lessons, and Leon rewards them by becoming a great player. But as an adult, Leon finds that people want more from him than just music.
movies.simplePlot: Young Leon Kanter dreams of being a great violinist. His parents scrape up the money for a violin and for lessons, and Leon rewards them by becoming a great player. But as an adult, Leon ...

biography.bio: Gaston Glass was born on December 31, 1899 in Paris, France as Gaston-Jacques Glass. He was a production manager and actor, known for Peyton Place (1964), Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea (1964) and 12 O'Clock High (1964). He was married to Bo Peep Karlin. He died on November 11, 1965 in Santa Monica, California, USA.
biography.name: Gaston Glass

biography.bio: American character actor of Russian heritage in silent films and early talkies. She emigrated with her family to the U.S. when she was seven years old. She became involved in the theatre even as a child and participated for several years in the Jewish theatre in New York. At the age of 34 she was cast by Frank Borzage in his version of 'Humoresque (1920)', and thereafter played in dozens of films, often as the family matriarch. She appeared in several films in the comedic Cohens and Kellys series. She died in 1948.
biography.name: Vera Gordon

biography.bio: Alma Rubens was born Alma Genevieve Reubens in San Francisco, California. She was interested in entertaining at an early age. Like most young girls, she enjoyed fantasy play acting and by the time she was 19 had become a full-fledged star. She didn't have to wait long like some of the starlets who haunted casting offices continually. Her break came in 1916 in the film Reggie Mixes In (1916). Six more films followed that year, and she won critical acclaim in The Half-Breed (1916). In 1917 she again starred in a box-office smash, The Firefly of Tough Luck (1917). She became a busy young actress with role after role and hit after hit. In 1924, as Mildred Gower, she performed magnificently in The Price She Paid (1924). After a busy 1925, Alma suddenly found it difficult to obtain work, but it was not because her star had suddenly dimmed--it was because of her addiction to heroin. The money she made dwindled away in search of the next high. She was in and out of mental asylums, but it didn't really help much because she was still dabbling in drugs. Weakened by her habit, she died in Los Angeles in 1931, of pneumonia. She was less than a month away from her 34th birthday. Her final two films were two years earlier, Show Boat (1929) and She Goes to War (1929).
biography.name: Alma Rubens

biography.placeOfBirth: New York City, New York, USA
biography.bio: Dore Davidson was born on October 16, 1851 in New York City, New York, USA. He was an actor, known for Humoresque (1920), None So Blind (1923) and Welcome Stranger (1924). He died on March 7, 1930 in New York City.
biography.name: Dore Davidson

biography.bio: Bobby Connelly was born on April 4, 1909 in Brooklyn, New York, USA as Robert Joseph Connelly. He was an actor, known for Sonny Jim and the Great American Game (1915), An Easter Lily (1914) and The White and Black Snowball (1915). He died on July 5, 1922 in Lynbrook, Long Island, New York.
biography.name: Bobby Connelly

biography.bio: Helen Connelly was born on March 15, 1908 in Brooklyn, New York, USA as Helen E. Connelly. She was an actress, known for Humoresque (1920), The Prince in Disguise (1915) and The Professor's Romance (1914). She was married to Anthony Merse. She died in July 1987 in Belford, New Jersey, USA.
biography.name: Helen Connelly

biography.bio: Ann Wallack is an actress, known for Humoresque (1920) and Nothing But Lies (1920).
biography.name: Ann Wallack

biography.bio: Sidney Carlyle was born on August 29, 1893 in Yarmouth, England as Sidney D. Carlyle. He was an actor, known for The Fable of the Tip and the Treasure (1915), Humoresque (1920) and Temper (1915). He died on November 3, 1962 in San Bernardino, California, USA.
biography.name: Sidney Carlyle

biography.bio: Joseph Cooper was born on October 7, 1912 in Westbury-on-Trym, Bristol, England as Joseph Elliott Needham Cooper. He was an actor and writer, known for Joyce Grenfell 1910-1979 (1980), Humoresque (1920) and Face the Music (1967). He was married to Carol Borg and Jean Greig. He died on August 4, 2001 in Guildford, Surrey, England.
biography.name: Joseph Cooper

biography.bio: Maurice Levigne is an actor, known for Humoresque (1920).
biography.name: Maurice Levigne

biography.bio: Alfred Goldberg was born in 1913 in Brooklyn, New York, USA. He is an actor, known for Humoresque (1920).
biography.name: Alfred Goldberg

biography.bio: Edward Stanton is an actor, known for Humoresque (1920).
biography.name: Edward Stanton

biography.placeOfBirth: New York City, New York, USA
biography.bio: Louis Stern was born on January 10, 1860 in New York City, New York, USA. He was an actor, known for Where East Is East (1929), Liberty Bond Jimmy (1918) and Annabelle Lee (1921). He was married to Peggy Ward. He died on February 15, 1941 in Hollywood, Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: Louis Stern

biography.bio: Maurice Peckre is an actor, known for Humoresque (1920).
biography.name: Maurice Peckre

biography.bio: Ruth Sabin is known for her work on Humoresque (1920) and About Mom and Dad... (2014).
biography.name: Ruth Sabin
